skill.name: database-migration-helper
skill.description: Creates database migration files following project conventions for Prisma, Sequelize, Alembic, Knex, TypeORM, and other ORMs. Use when adding tables, modifying schemas, or when user mentions database changes.
skill.summary: Creates database migration files following project conventions for Prisma, Sequelize, Alembic, Knex,...
skill.author: CrazyDubya

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing documentation, templates, and guidance for creating database migrations. No executable code, no network access, no sensitive data access. All capabilities (Read, Write, Grep, Glob, Bash) are appropriate for the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Database migrations are tedious to write manually and easy to get wrong. This skill generates properly formatted migration files for any ORM with up and down methods, follows your project conventions, and includes rollback support.
actual_capabilities: Detects ORM framework from project files
Creates migration files with proper naming conventions
Includes indexes, foreign keys, and constraints
Follows project-specific patterns and directory structure
limitations: Does not execute migrations on databases
Does not validate migration logic against existing schema
Does not generate data transformation scripts
Requires user to review and run generated migrations

use_cases.title: Add new tables and columns
use_cases.description: Generate migrations for new database tables with proper types, constraints, and relationships

use_cases.title: Modify existing schemas
use_cases.description: Create migrations that alter columns, add indexes, or update table structures safely

use_cases.title: Standardize migration patterns
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent naming conventions and rollback support across multiple projects

prompt_templates.title: Create users table
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a migration to add a users table with id (uuid), email (unique, not null), name, created_at, and updated_at fields.

prompt_templates.title: Add column to table
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a status column to the orders table with a default value of pending and a foreign key reference to users.

prompt_templates.title: Create index
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a migration that adds a unique index on the email column in the users table.

prompt_templates.title: Rollback migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a migration that rolls back the previous migration by dropping the products table and its indexes.

output_examples.input: Create a migration to add a users table with email and name fields
output: Includes: CREATE TABLE statement with id, email, name, timestamps
Includes: Unique index on email column
Review the generated SQL before running with: npx prisma migrate dev

best_practices: Always test migrations on development database before production
Include both forward and rollback methods for safe reversibility
Use descriptive names that explain what the migration does
anti_patterns: Combining multiple unrelated schema changes in one migration
Using vague names like migration1 or update
Skipping rollback/down methods for complex migrations

faq.question: Which ORM frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Supports Prisma, Sequelize, Knex, TypeORM, Alembic (Python), Rails, Django, Flyway, and Liquibase.

faq.question: Does this execute migrations?
faq.answer: No, it only generates migration files. You must review and run them using your ORM CLI tools.

faq.question: How are migrations named?
faq.answer: Uses timestamp-based naming (YYYYMMDDHHMMSS_description) or sequential numbering following project conventions.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only generates migration file content. It does not access your database or execute any commands.

faq.question: What if my project uses a custom ORM?
faq.answer: Provide your existing migration files and patterns, and the skill will follow your project's conventions.

faq.question: How is this different from ORM CLI tools?
faq.answer: ORM CLI tools generate basic migrations. This skill helps create comprehensive migrations with proper constraints, indexes, and rollback support.
